title: Indian Constitution Preamble: Complete MCQ Bank (99 Questions)
description: Comprehensive exam-focused MCQ questions covering Preamble with answers and explanations

sampleQuestions.question: The Preamble is based on which resolution?
sampleQuestions.explanation: The Preamble is based on the Objectives Resolution moved by Jawaharlal Nehru on 13 Dec 1946.

sampleQuestions.question: When was the Preamble adopted?
sampleQuestions.explanation: It was adopted by the Constituent Assembly on 26 November 1949.

sampleQuestions.question: When did the Constitution come into effect?
sampleQuestions.explanation: Constitution came into force on 26 January 1950 (Republic Day).

sampleQuestions.question: Which Amendment added the words 'Socialist' and 'Secular' to the Preamble?
Which of the following is NOT one of the words describing the nature of the Indian State in the Preamble?
sampleQuestions.explanation: Preamble says Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic — not 'Federal'.

sampleQuestions.question: Which case declared the Preamble to be part of the Constitution and part of Basic Structure?
sampleQuestions.explanation: Kesavananda Bharati (1973) held Preamble is part of the Constitution and forms part of Basic Structure.

sampleQuestions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate short mnemonic for the Preamble's objectives?
sampleQuestions.explanation: JLEF stands for Justice, Liberty, Equality, Fraternity — the Preamble objectives.

sampleQuestions.question: In mnemonic terms, what does SSCDR stand for?
sampleQuestions.explanation: SSCDR is short for Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic.

sampleQuestions.question: Which one of these is the best short mnemonic to remember the Preamble's nature (SSCDR)?
sampleQuestions.explanation: The mnemonic 'Strong Sexy Smart Desi Raja' is used to remember SSCDR.

sampleQuestions.question: Which famous jurist called the Preamble the 'Identity Card' of the Constitution?
sampleQuestions.explanation: N. A. Palkiwala called the Preamble the Identity Card of the Constitution.

natureOfState: Sovereign - Independent in internal and external affairs
Socialist - Aims at reducing socio-economic inequality
Secular - No official religion, equal respect to all
Democratic - Government by people, for people
Republic - Elected head of state, not hereditary
fourObjectives: Liberty: Thought, Expression, Belief, Faith, Worship
judicialInterpretation: Berubari Union Case (1960): Preamble NOT part of Constitution (old view)
Kesavananda Bharati (1973): Preamble IS part and embodies Basic Structure
LIC of India (1995): Reaffirmed Preamble's integral status

studyTips: Remember SSCDR = Strong Sexy Smart Desi Raja
Remember JLEF = Justice, Liberty, Equality, Fraternity
Remember TEBFW = Thali, Egg, Bag, Fan, Water (for five liberties)
Remember SEP = Social, Economic, Political (three justice types)
42nd Amendment is ONLY amendment to Preamble
Kesavananda case changed Preamble's constitutional status
Preamble is not directly enforceable but used for interpretation
examFocus: Frequently tested in UPSC Civil Services
note: Full 99-question bank available in seed script and data/notes.json. This file contains sample questions for reference. Use this alongside the published_notes table in Supabase for complete preamble MCQ preparation.
